g.text: UMA communications platform - Bob from Alice (pull data)
If Bob uses an email provider (outlook) that does not support
the WebFinger protocol, he must set up his mailbox to automatically
forward emails sent from challenge@bar.com to response@bar.com
• publishes its metadata on a URL https:
• is registered at Bob's IAM Server and is assigned 'query-users', 'view-users' admin roles, thus can query and view any user to get their claims
• can send email messages from address challenge@bar.com and retrieve from response@bar.com
• is registered at bar.com IAM Server and pre-registered as a universal AEMS public client at foo.com UMA Server
• is an agent that can act on behalf of any user registered at bar.com IAM Server
foo.com Admin has set up the Resource Server and registers it's resource set
'Incoming' and 'Outgoing' with the foo.com UMA Server with the associated scopes
• the email_address is specified by RqP Client
10. Send plain_message from challenge@bar.com to bob@outlook.com
11. Retrieve dkim_signed_message sent from bob@outlook.com to response@bar.com
if the payload is large, consider using PCT (see UMA specs. for details)
In addition to claims_token, pushed claims may also contain metadata such as:
• file_info (filename, file size, file digest, mime type)
3. bootstrap discovery of Claims Provider config url from email address via WebFinger;
if this doesn't work, build well-known url using domain part of email_address
8. evaluate other optional claims e.g. recipient_info, file_info
3. extract 'From:' part of dkim_signed_message e.g. Bob Sanders <bob@outlook.com>
4. extract claims_provider_configuration_url and ticket_challenge from dkim_signed_message
9. evaluate other optional claims e.g. recipient_info, file_info
[Bob has to demonstrate control of his mailbox]
[Bob has to demonstrate control of his mailbox]
[Domain part of email_address or WebFinger is used to locate Claims Provider configuration url]
[Bob has to demonstrate control of his mailbox]
